intro: Fleischmannia rhodotephra, commonly known as the red-flowered fleischmannia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spineless stems and showy, red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Fleischmannia rhodotephra is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
